author: Richard Nystrom
title: Elixir SDK
description: Right now you can access the cardano-wallet using the built in REST API but Elixir does not have a higher-level library to use the wallet.

assessments.note: One of several API wrapper proposals. Fits squarely within the scope of the challenge.

I like the proposal and how it addresses the issue. Also it brings advantages to Cardano from versatility point of view. The proposer has focus on the maintenance and long term plans which is beneficial.
This seems like a reasonable extension to the developer toolkit.
This propsal is going to enable Elixir developers to start building on Cardano and therefore addresses the challenge.
Simplifying the use of Cardano for different programming languages fits very well with the chosen challenge. An SDK for Elexir would implement this requirement.
This is not complex or innovative and the proposer already delivered related work, therefore I have high confidence in the ability to execute.

Cost / benefit ratio is very positive in this project. The proposer openly shares his experience and has confidence in doing the job. Moreover highlights the long term plans and maintenance aspects, which is usually always forgotten.
The proposer did provide clear references to their experience.
The proposer has presented his experience in similar projects and also already got with the implementation. The available information is convincing.
Not really a detailed plan but doable by one developer in a reasonable amount of time.
Regarding the metrics I do like the comparison to the Ethereum downloads, since that's a reasonable target to achieve. The project status can be tracked also.
The timeline is well define, as well as the goals.

Criteria for determining successful implementation are in place, although the criteria are somewhat vague. The release date of 2021-08-01 is very concrete and well usable. Even better would be several milestones, which would allow a finer gradation of auditing.

solution: Create an SDK that implements modules to make Elixir developers able to use Wallets, Addresses, Keys, Transactions, etc
